project.name: Machine Learning
project.description: Applied k-means clustering and elbow method using Python scikit-learn to identify the genres of movies based on movie script (NLP).

project.name: wordNet
project.description: Designed and implemented a browser-based tool for exploring the history of word usage in English texts using Java OOP and Google Ngram dataset. Based on the user’s choice of words and time range, the most relevant words that are most commonly used during that timeframe are displayed.

project.name: Game generator
project.description: Designed and implemented a random world generator engine depending on seed (number) input. Expected to generate a user-interactive 2D tile-based world and a full gaming environment using Java OOP.

project.name: Hey-Doctor
project.description: Hey-Doctor is a platform that is built to increase the accessibility of the medical system to a broader range of people, including unprivileged people who can’t afford medical services financially.

activity.name: NASA Space Apps Challenge, [Hawalli, Kuwait]
activity.description:
﹒1st place national level
﹒Nominated for developing an application ‘spot that fire’ which calculated the chances for a natural disaster occurrence in areas through the implementation of a machine learning algorithm.
  ﹒ Has achieved 95% accuracy based on certified NASA data.

activity.name:
Korean Undergraduate Networking Association,
President/PR Director [Berkeley, CA]
activity.description:
